poker.calculator

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.calculator.Simulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PokerCalculator

    public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
implements PokerCalculator
    Calculates the pre-flop all-in equity for two Hold'em hands using a Monte Carlo simulation.

      • calculateEquity

        public void calculateEquity(java.lang.String hand1,
                   java.lang.String hand2)
        Description copied from interface: PokerCalculator
        Calculates the equity of two hands. Equity is defined as winning percentage + tie percentage / 2. For example, if the pot size is 100 and the equity is 60 %, it means that the expected stack size is 0.6*100=60.
        Specified by:
        calculateEquity in interface PokerCalculator
        Parameters:
        hand1 - string expression of the first hand
        hand2 - string expression of the second hand
